attributes.action: suggest to the House of Commons that it creates a new post of Parliamentary Nominee to the Bank of England’s Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) who will have the same standing and voting rights on the MPC as all other MPC members. Members of Parliament will elect the Parliamentary Nominee from a shortlist of six economists who will be chosen by a special cross-party Parliamentary Committee comprising only backbench MPs.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: This measure is proposed both to increase the effectiveness of ordinary backbench Members of Parliament, and also to ensure that a wider range of economic opinions is represented at the highest level of financial and economic decision-making. Economic management of the recent past might have been better if such opinions had been represented from within the MPC.

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with Parliament.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
